titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William M. Bartley, Indictment
CWG4156

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mason Circuit Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Indictment
William. M. Bartley

The Grand Jury of Mason County, in the name, and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William. M. Bartley of the crime of Grand Larceny. committed as follows; The said William. M. Bartley on the day of June 1863. at the county aforesaid feloniously took and carried away one coat & one pocket book the personal property of R. W. Watkins of the value of more than four Dollars. against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Geo. M Thomas
Attorney for the Commonwealth.

The following verdict was rendered herein, towit: "We the jury find the defendant guilty and fix his punishment at one years confiement in the Penitentiary, and we recommend to the Govenor to pardon him before the close of his term. We do this in view of the circumstances disclosed on the trial.

A copy attest
Jno M. Duke Jr Clerk
Mason Circuit Court.

The Comlth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment for Grand Larceny
William. M. Bartley,
Copy Examined.
